reviewText:
I remember I used to watch this movie when I was like 15 years old and it was one of my favourite ones. Why? Because of the erotic contents. You won't find a really sexual movie here, but instead, a really EROTIC and captivating movie. It makes you want more and more. I am really happy to have found this movie again after so many years. And of course. Lisa Barbuscia is one of the most beautiful girls around.

Cheers.

R.

It may be a poor movie, but it is an opportunity  to see once of the most beautiful women in the world, Lisa Barbuscia.  Her eyes...and the rest her are simply breath taking
see her in the last Highlander and Almost Heroes, where she plays the part of the Indian maiden.  Her eyes make me melt.
Jeff Fahey quite pathetic, the movie however is a good time pass
Not really my type of flick.
I cannot recommend this movie.  The acting was okay but I can't approve of the subject matter and the nudity.
A good reminder on how things can go not exactly like you might hope.
Bad very bad! I would have thrown it away if had bought it.

Watched it as a teenager and just came across it so it had to give it another look. Let me tell you 20 years changes alot! I don't recommend going back and watching skinemax you have fond memories of as a teenager!
Women are predictably tired, stereotypically, sexually exploitive witches, sez this script & director. Yawn.
Good stars... sort of lame on content!

Not a bad movie - the plot is a fairly simplistic rendition of the theme of a couple broken apart by one of them being seduced by a supernatural being.  The acting is fair to good, and most of the screen time is the husband and the succubus.  This is a solid 3 star movie, except the ending which was a little disappointing.

This movie is about a man who encounters a succubus.  The movie isn't horrible by my definition but it really isn't that great also.  It's a free movie on Amazon Prime so that's a positive about it in my opinion
I found it to be a boring movie, The female star is beautiful but have a story line the is interesting  so we are hooked.
You really have old movies it's really not worth the $99 a year, you need to be more like redbox
Not good.  Watched about 10 minutes.  Very dated.
Unique slant, worth a look smoking hot girl shape shifter.  Not great but is worth seeing
Predictable.  The cat lady is very sexy!
Feels like a poor attempt at a "Rosemary's Baby" type of plot.
I wasn't expecting much given the image associated with the story.  Jeff Fahey I remembered from several B movies.  The rest of the actors I was unfamiliar with.  I can't honestly recomend it.
Not bad, hard to find a good scary movie.
Older B movie of witchcraft but was able to hold your interest with a good story.  Quality of the movie was not great, had lots of grain and bad scene transitions with poor sound quality.
Cheap dim quality is low. But the nudity starts pretty quickly. Weird storyline though.
Script and characters well done. Timeliness ok just too extended
Had to keep fast forwarding; terrible movie.
dated but subtle and intense in its own way but scary? not at all
suspense, erotic, good story line. but the end is kind of disappointing.
This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen.

For a "B" movie, Serpent's Lair is in my opinion one of the best done stories and films in that genre. The story is very well done with no holes in the plot or development. Due to the sexual nature of the subject matter, there are sexual scenes in the film but they are not gratuitous or merely thrown in your face just to have sex in it. All are an integral part of the story and plot and are very tastefully done. For those who enjoy stories of the supernatural, this one is one of the best I have seen.
It's a low budget movie... Enough said
Slow moving and no real drama. Nothing left to your imagination.

In a word, this was a disappointing film. Jeff Fehey and the rest of the cast are all, to say the least, serviceable actors but this story suffers from a simple script and most importantly, fails to scare. I love a good devil, witch, demon story but the first priority of any such film is the scare factor and I cannot identify even one such moment in this film. This movie labors through run of the mill plots points under the umbrella of a B+ production that all seem to drag on a bit too long and fail to deliver any real energy, titillation, or frights.

I have an affinity for "B side" possession films. I have no idea why. Honestly, the narrative is almost completely one dimensional: however, the female succubus is quite appealing. This flick is worth the time just for the sex romps. I am not too keen on the preoccupation with cats though. This is based on a variation of Celtic folklore that really has little use for the plot of this movie. I just wanted to see as much foreplay as possible.
I like B movies I could not watch this one dragged on too long.
She's amazingly sexy in this flick.

An ab-soul-utely must-watch experience!  Lisa B really tears up the screen!  You'll doubt that cats were ever real to begin with!  Simply everyone must watch this gloriously high-contrast cautionary tale about being Charlie Sheen!
Performance were unspectacular, appears like a home-made movie. Plot oversimplified and totally predictable

Another wind-breaking physiological masterpiece. I was so impressed that I wanted to eat sweet breads (cow brains) after seeing it.
Truly inspirational!
Good old school fantasy horror movie.  Once it gets going can't stop watching. Just when you think she is done with him she comes back for more!
Two stars that's all I can give.
Just say no. What a yawner.
It was a chezzy movie if it wasn't for the good looking woman  it would be boring
Pretty silly. The gal  tried so hard to be sexy but it just didn't work for her. It came across as quite amusing
Lets just say, there is considerable room for improvement with this one.
Total waste of time watched a few minutes and then turned it off
Very entertaining and loaded with twist and turns.
not bad upt to the ending. the las 15-20 min were the worst. guess they had to save some money to market it. for the most part pretty good. but the ending was just really bad.
The best part of the movie is the cover photo.
Kind of a sexy horror show
This probably went straight to VHS back in it's day.

sexy doesn't describe the lead woman. worth it just for that. but it was GOOD until WT@#$ happened at the end!!?

like Norton said when Ralph gave him the tickets to "Murder Strikes Out" even though he knew the ending.

"When it gets close to the end, i'll get up and walk out"

good idea for this movie.
Nice looking women with a little suspense.
imagination and power grub of erotic woman's fantasies, as the devil.
This movie needs an updated remake!...Sexy as hell!
One woman gives a couple topless scenes and one far and away full frontal
I bumble-fingered and they charged me for this.
actually good story, sin bringing down a strong man who barely saves his own soul. would send it to someone else too see

This movie is basically a vampire movie with the roles reversed.  A mysterious, insatiable smoking-hot female who won't take no for an answer wears her men out the old fashioned way.  The poor guy only realizes it when it's too late.

People with intellectual pretentions will only mock it, since it's obviously in bad taste and not "clever" enough for them. And I doubt it would appeal to women much, since it is completely lacking in mysterious smoking-hot men who won't take no for an answer. So, not a date movie either.  In other words, this is basically a guy guilty pleasure.  Like Showgirls.

The screenwriter may be a Jungian.  Three and a half stars.

Loved this as a kid...and adult!  That Lisa B. who plays the seductress lady is smoking hot!  This has to be one of the most underrated seductive movies out there.  Its not porn...more so sexy sex. lol!
The chick in the movie did exactly what the cover says "She hunts to mate, she mates to kill." Adult scenes were great. I just wished there were a few more scenes of that girl. Oh well.
Better film than I remembered.  A little cheesy at times, but also very sexy.

SERPENT'S LAIR (aka: THE NESTING- 1995) stars Jeff Fahey (PSYCHO 3) as Tom Bennett, who, along w/ his wife Alex (Heather Medway), are shown their dream apartment. This, after the opening scene showed the previous tenant committing suicide there! While touring the place, the Bennett's can see the burn marks -it was set ablaze- as well as the cryptic, red message painted on the wall! Undeterred, they move right in. Weird things begin happening almost immediately, and the weird music lets us know that it's only going to get weirder. Sam, their ultra-suave neighbor, seems too good to be true. Their new cat also seems odd, causing alex to feel threatened. Meanwhile, Tom's dreams take a turn for the more erotic. When a cat-caused "accident" puts Alex in the hospital, a woman named Lillith (Lisa Barbuscia), claiming to be the sister of the former occupant, stops by. Lillith is a dazzling beauty, and winds up alone w/ Tom in the apartment for the evening. It's obvious he's having trouble keeping his eyes off her, and it's not long before Tom forgets he's married to what's-her-name! For some reason, more cats arrive. When a nosy neighbor complains, he has a "heart attack". Soon, Lillith makes her move on Tom. She's not one for small talk, either! Yikes! Luckily, Tom's mother in-law stops by, putting the kibosh on Lillith's plans... temporarily. Sadly, Tom has no idea what he's really up against, as this is not a normal woman. In fact, she's not even human! Therefor, Tom just might be doomed. A movie like SERPENT'S LAIR is all about building, sexual tension, w/ the consummation thereof leading to total destruction. Lillith, being a wicked spirit, is insatiable and unstoppable, even barging in at Tom's job, bringing his work to an abrupt halt. The ensuing "office chair" scene is as humorous as it is sensual, w/ Tom's imbecilic business partner Mario, listening through the office door like some overgrown, demented kid! When Alex -finally- returns home unexpectedly, she discovers clear evidence of Tom and Lillith's shenanigans. Is his marriage finished? Simultaneously, even more kitty cats seem to be hanging around. Will Tom realize what's truly going on? Will he snap out of his Lillith coma in time to defeat her, before she reduces him to a smiling sack of dust? Will he be able to afford enough food and litter boxes for his growing multitude of felines? Oh my friends, let nothing in heaven or on earth keep you from witnessing Tom's freak-out, occult, demon-cleansing, fiery, final throw-down / showdown! It goes nowhere, but it's fun to watch!...

From 1995, this is more like psychological torture than horror.  Yes, there's a succubus (sp?), but most of the movie is about the mild erotica and the victim who can't escape the villains and their enchantments, so to speak.  If you have "stalker scars" then you will want to avoid this movie.  It has no scares, but the cats are beautiful.  As always, Jeff Fahey makes having eyes a wonderful thing.
Very forced acting. Very high contrast filming, ending was terrible. Storyline was good, just poor execution of it.
The cinematographer of this film was irresponsible
One of those old "transparent" movies. The kind where the viewer knows everything that's going on - so obvious, while the characters are utterly clueless. Don't bother.
